meanings.definition: Having a rough or uneven surface that causes irritation or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The new blanket was scratchier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: The cat's tongue felt scratchier than sandpaper.
meanings.sent3: The scratchier fabric made the baby giggle as she squirmed on it.
meanings.sent4: The scratchier texture of the road seemed to whisper tales of ancient journeys.
meanings.sent5: The scratchier material left red marks on her delicate skin.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that scratches or causes scratching.
meanings.sent1: The kitten was the scratchier of the two pets.
meanings.sent2: The tree bark felt scratchier than the cat's fur.
meanings.sent3: The scratchier of the siblings always found a way to get into mischief.
meanings.sent4: The scratchier of the two friends had a habit of leaving marks wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The scratchier of the pencils was always the favorite for detailed drawings.

meanings.definition: To make a mark or tear on a surface with something sharp or rough.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally scratchiered the table while moving the vase.
meanings.sent2: The cat scratchiered the door to be let in.
meanings.sent3: He scratchiered his initials into the tree trunk as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The artist scratchiered a beautiful design onto the clay pot.
meanings.sent5: The keys scratchiered the surface of the phone with each press.
